subject: Re: [junit] setUp versus constructors
msgSnippet: But do keep in mind This behavior is not (yet?) part of the API, however : http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/17102 David Saff
messageBody:
But do keep in mind "This behavior is not (yet?) part of the API, however":

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/17102

David Saff

Duncan McGregor wrote:
> On 22 Jul 2006, at 18:48, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>> You can rely on setUp() working tomorrow the way it does today. Not so
>> for the constructor. Compare with NUnit.
>>
> I think we're all agreed that in JUnit 3 the constructors are invoked
> as the suite is built, and setUp is called as part of runBare.
>
> In JUnit 4 the behaviour is that the tests are constructed and their
> @Before and setUp methods called as part of the test run, just before
> each @Test method. The current behaviour is also that @After is
> called, and then the test reference released for garbage collection.
>
> Given David's previous statement - http://groups.yahoo.com/group/
> junit/message/17098
> I think we we can probably rely on constructors being run just before
> setUp
>
> Duncan McGregor
>
>
